Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Daniel S Erickson was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with Green Lake County sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or go upon any premises whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway unless authorized by MVD.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle with any alcohol or detectable restricted controlled substances in his blood.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

ADA Freeman present.
Def. present - in custody.
Atty. Borkenhagen present.
Plea questionnaire filed with the Court.
Ct. #1 - NC Plea
Court questions def.
Court finds def. waives his rights, finds a factual basis exists, and finds def. guilty of Ct. #1 (5th offense).
Ct. #2 is dismissed and Ct. #3 is D&RI.
Recommendations by ADA Freeman and Atty. Borkenhagen.
WI State Prison System - initial confinement of 2 years 8 months and extended supervision of 3 years - sentence to run concurrent with Green Lake County sentence.
59 days jail credit.
Conditons of extended supervision:
1.  def. to pay fine of $1200.00 + $42.50 blood draw = $2569.50
2.  def. to participate in AODA & DSP.
3.  def. to participate in any counseling and assessments as directed by agent.
4.  def. to not possess or consume any alcohol or go upon any premises whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
5.  def. to operate vehicles equipped with IID for a period of 24 months - 1/2 price IID exemption order signed this date.
6.  def. to not operate a MV on hwy unless authorized by MVD.
7.  def. to not operate a MV with any alcohol or detectable restricted controlled substances in his system.
d.l. revoked for 36 months
